column2: Apply to join the United Naitons as a member state.

We have begun the process of joining the United Nations as a member state. Whether we are permitted into the organisation at this time or not will depend on the opinions held by the UN's Permanent Members.\nThrough the UN we hope to gain a voice on the international diplomatic stage, shape the creation of new international law, and benefit from the collective security the organisation provides.\n

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has begun the process of joining the United Nations as a member state. As a UN Permanent Member we have the option of vetoing this application but doing so would come at the cost of some of our international prestige.
$FROMCOUNTRY$, that is a UN Permanent Member state has chosen to veto our current application to the United Nations. We will be able to attempt this process again in two years time.

None of the UN Permanent Member states have chosen to veto our application to the United Nations and thus our membership application will now move forward through the UN's legal processes by being forwarded to the Secretary General.
We have recieved word that the United Nations Security Council has formally accepted our application to join the UN as a member state. We can now fully participate in the organisation.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has begun the process of joining the United Nations, and has not had its application vetoed by any of the UN's Permanent Members.\nAs the current Secretary General of the United Nations we will now progress this application through the relevant legal processes, although we may have the option of fast-tracking it.
Let the process run its course
